title: Trump Plunges the U.S. Into a New Era of Risk in Venezuela
summary: President Trump opened a new chapter in American nation building as he declared that the United States had toppled Venezuela’s leader and would “run” the country for an indefinite period.

title: A Pardon and a Prosecution in New York Show Trump’s Personal Geopolitics
summary: The facts in the cases of Nicolás Maduro and Juan Orlando Hernández are strikingly similar. The men’s fates are not.

title: The U.S. Indictment of Maduro Cites Cocaine Smuggling. Venezuela’s Role in the Trade Is Believed to Be Modest.
summary: Experts have said that Venezuela is not a major drug producer but a minor cocaine transit country, with most of the cocaine flowing through it headed to Europe.

title: Ukrainian Politics Has Reawakened. Zelensky Must Tread Carefully.
summary: The Ukrainian leader is reshuffling his cabinet as a corruption scandal reshapes the political landscape at a pivotal point in peace negotiations.

title: Ambassador Kimberly Guilfoyle, the Talk of Athens
summary: The former fiancée of Donald Trump Jr., and the former wife of Gov. Gavin Newsom, is working hard and pushing deals with American business interests. She’s also up late at parties.

title: Inside Mamdani’s Decision to Revoke Executive Orders That Backed Israel
summary: Mr. Mamdani, a staunch critic of Israel and its treatment of Palestinians, knew he would not extend the orders, but he had to decide how and when he would rescind them.

title: On a Brooklyn Boulevard, Mamdani Revives a Project Hampered by Scandal
summary: The bike-lane project, a source of corruption charges during the Adams administration, will be finished as planned in Greenpoint, Mayor Zohran Mamdani said.

title: This Is What Venezuelans Really Want
summary: We have long faced a brutal paradox: an absent yet omnipotent state.

title: Tom Brady Is Not the GOAT
summary: That’s not a criticism of Brady. It’s a criticism of how greatness is considered.

title: Heavy Rain and King Tides Cause Flooding in California
summary: Highways were blocked and a regional airport shut down on Saturday when the latest in a long run of drenching rainstorms coincided with especially high tides.

title: Why Security Guarantees Are So Crucial, and Thorny, for Ukraine
summary: While Kyiv has reported progress in negotiations, and is accelerating talks in the coming days, major questions remain unresolved about which countries will provide what kind of security for how long.

title: Hannah Dugan, Wisconsin Judge Convicted of Obstructing Immigration Agents, Resigns
summary: Hannah C. Dugan, a state court judge, was convicted by a jury in federal court. Wisconsin lawmakers called on her to resign from the bench.

title: Richard Pollak, 91, Dies; Edited Magazine That Criticized the Media
summary: He was a founder of More, which skewered the foibles of the press in the 1970s, and later wrote a critical biography of the psychoanalyst Bruno Bettelheim.
